trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryAuditRule"></xref> is used to set an access control entry (ACE) on a system access control list (SACL).

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryAccessRule"></xref> contains the trustee, which is represented as an <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.AuthorizationRule.IdentityReference"></xref> object.
It also contains information about the access control type, access mask, and other properties such as inheritance flags.
This rule is set on an <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurity"></xref> object.

After the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurity"></xref> is committed to the directory store, it will modify the security descriptor object according to the rules that are set on <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryAuditRule"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryAuditRule"></xref> class with the specified identity, rights, and flags.
Specifies an <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"></xref> object, such as an NTAccount object, that resolves to a security identifier (SID).

Specifies an <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights"></xref> object, which is used to define all the rights that can be set on a directory object, as defined in the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights"></xref> enumeration.

Specifies an <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags"></xref> object, which contains the combination of one or more audit flags to add to this <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryAuditRule"></xref>.
The allowable flags are <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags.Success"></xref> and <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags.Failure"></xref>.
This parameter may not be zero.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryAuditRule"></xref> class with the specified identity, rights, flags, and inheritance type.
Specifies an <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"></xref> object, such as an NTAccount object, that resolves to a security identifier (SID).

Specifies an <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights"></xref> object, which is used to define all the rights that can be set on a directory object, as defined in the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights"></xref> enumeration.

Specifies an <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags"></xref> object, which contains a combination of one or more audit flags to add to this <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryAuditRule"></xref>.
The allowable flags are <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags.Success"></xref> and <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags.Failure"></xref>.
This parameter can not be zero.
Specifies the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurityInheritance"></xref> object that contains inheritance information.
The allowable flags for this parameter are found in the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurityInheritance"></xref> enumeration.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryAuditRule"></xref> class with the specified identity, rights, flags, and object type.
Specifies an <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"></xref> object, such as an NTAccount object, that resolves to a security identifier (SID).

Specifies an <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights"></xref> object, which is used to define all the rights that can be set on a directory object, as defined in the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights"></xref> enumeration.

Specifies an <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags"></xref> object, which contains the combination of one or more audit flags to add to this <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryAuditRule"></xref>.
The allowable flags are <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags.Success"></xref> and <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags.Failure"></xref>.
This parameter can not be zero.
Specifies a <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> object that contains the GUID of the object to which the access permissions apply.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryAuditRule"></xref> class with the specified identity, rights, flags, inheritance type, and inherited object type.
Specifies an <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"></xref> object, such as an NTAccount object, that resolves to a security identifier (SID).

Specifies an <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights"></xref> data type object, which is used to define all the rights that can be set on a directory object, as defined in the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights"></xref> enumeration.

Specifies an <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags"></xref> object, which contains the combination of one or more audit flags to add to this <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryAuditRule"></xref>.
The allowable flags are <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags.Success"></xref> and <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags.Failure"></xref>.
This parameter may not be zero.
Specifies the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurityInheritance"></xref> object that contains inheritance information.
The allowable flags for this parameter are found in the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurityInheritance"></xref> enumeration.
Specifies the <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> object that identifies the type of child object that can inherit this access rule.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryAuditRule"></xref> class with the specified identity, rights, flags, object type, and inheritance type.
Specifies an <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"></xref> object, such as an NTAccount object, that resolves to a security identifier (SID).

Specifies an <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights"></xref> object, which is used to define all the rights that can be set on a directory object, as defined in the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights"></xref> enumeration.

Specifies an <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags"></xref> object, which contains the combination of one or more audit flags to add to this <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryAuditRule"></xref>.
The allowable flags are <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags.Success"></xref> and <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags.Failure"></xref>.
This parameter may not be zero.
Specifies a <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> object which contains the GUID of the object to which the access permissions apply.
Specifies the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurityInheritance"></xref> object that contains inheritance information.
The allowable flags for this parameter are found in the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurityInheritance"></xref> enumeration.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryAuditRule"></xref> class with the specified identity, rights, flags, object type, inheritance type, and inherited object type.
Specifies an <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"></xref> object, such as an NTAccount object, that resolves to a security identifier (SID).

Specifies an <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights"></xref> object, which is used to define all the rights that can be set on a directory object, as defined in the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights"></xref> enumeration.

Specifies an <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags"></xref> object, which contains the combination of one or more audit flags to add to this <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryAuditRule"></xref>.
The allowable flags are <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags.Success"></xref> and <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags.Failure"></xref>.
This parameter may not be zero.
Specifies a <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> object that contains the GUID of the object to which the access permissions apply.
Specifies the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurityInheritance"></xref> object that contains inheritance information.
The allowable flags for this parameter are found in the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurityInheritance"></xref> enumeration.
Specifies the <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> object that identifies the type of child object that can inherit this access rule.
Gets the rights for the audit rule.
One or more of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights"></xref> enumeration values that specifies the rights for the audit rule.
Gets the inheritance type of the audit rule.
One of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurityInheritance"></xref> enumeration values that specifies the inheritance type of the audit rule.
